remarks: Given the equivalences set in the hypotheses, there exist a proof where ch, th, ta, et match ze, si accordingly (Contributed by Jarvin Udandy, 7-Sep-2016.)
statement:
mdandyvr8.1 $e |- ( ph <-> ze ) $.
mdandyvr8.2 $e |- ( ps <-> si ) $.
mdandyvr8.3 $e |- ( ch <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr8.4 $e |- ( th <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr8.5 $e |- ( ta <-> ph ) $.
mdandyvr8.6 $e |- ( et <-> ps ) $.
mdandyvr8 $p |- ( ( ( ( ch <-> ze ) /\ ( th <-> ze ) ) /\ ( ta <-> ze ) ) /\ ( et <-> si ) ) $.
